p: Ribavirin is known to cause lethal mutagenesis, as shown in Fig. 5. Ribavirin is incorporated into the elongating RNA strand, resulting in the production of multiple mismatches that lead to lethal mutagenesis ( Vignuzzi et al., 2005). Favipiravir inhibits RNA synthesis through chain termination, and this inhibitory mechanism more consistently explains the observations reported than a mechanism similar to ribavirin, as described below.
